column4: Are there any other differences between kubuntu and ubuntu than one using KDE and one GNOME?
Ok, because my friend told me KDE was "far better" than GNOME... should I care about that statement?
Yeah, he claimed it was faster and all too, but I just thought I'll ask you guys instead.. Credibility, you know =)
you should try both and use the one you like to use more
Yeah I probably should. But I'm quite happy with Ubuntu
you can install both and choose which to use when you login
you should be installing software through APT
yes, see the second link ubottu gave you about compiling

the INSTALL and/or README files should tell you the libraries you need.  The error ./configure gave you should suggest it as well.  Once you figure out you need, you install the -dev package for the library
Yeah, I guess the error in the confige should say it aswell, but I've been reading alot now, and I don't see what the specific problem is... Can't i post it?
sure, put it up on paste.ubuntu.com
useless, you need to pastebin the README and INSTALL files too
ok.. I read them earlier and I think they may be useful.. wait
http://paste.ubuntu.com/16444/  I copy and pasted the install and readme-files in there too
did you see the paste? http://paste.ubuntu.com/16444/
the stuff in the readme (like ftdi_sio), is that taken care of?
I don't know how I possible could've missed that line... because I've read both of them... is it on synaptic.. well I'll try
